tit.e: Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai (period of three prefectures and one bureau)
Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai (period of three prefectures and one bureau)
Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai (period of three prefectures and one bureau)

sen.j: 三県一局時代（さんけんいっきょくじだい）とは、北海道の歴史における時代区分のひとつ。
sen.e: Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai is one of the periods within the framework of periodization of history of Hokkaido.
Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai is one of the periods within the framework of periodization in the history of Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: of history→in the history としました。
sen.e: Sanken-Ikkyoku Jidai is one of the periods within the framework of periodization in the history of Hokkaido.

sen.j: 1882年2月8日の開拓使廃止に伴い、函館県（はこだてけん）・札幌県（さっぽろけん）・根室県（ねむろけん）が設置された（「廃使置県（はいしちけん）」）。
sen.e: When Hokkaido Development Commissioner was abolished on February 8, 1882, Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture and Nemuro Prefecture were established at the same time ("Haishi Chiken," or abolishment of Commissioner and establishment of prefectures).

Due to the abolition of Hokkaido Development Commissioner on February 8, 1882, Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture and Nemuro Prefecture were established at the same time ('Haishi Chiken,' or abolishment of Commissioner and establishment of prefectures).
sen.cmt: When～→Due toの形の文に修正、クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Due to the abolition of Hokkaido Development Commissioner on February 8, 1882, Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture and Nemuro Prefecture were established at the same time ('Haishi Chiken,' or abolishment of Commissioner and establishment of prefectures).

sen.j: また、北海道にはこの3県のほか、北海道事業管理局（農商務省 (日本)の一部局）が設置されていた。
sen.e: In addition, along with the said three prefectures, Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau (one of the departments under No-Shomusho (Agriculture and Commerce Ministry)) was established in Hokkaido.
In addition, along with the said three prefectures, Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau (one of the departments under Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce[Japan]) was established in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 「農商務省」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, along with the said three prefectures, Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau (one of the departments under Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce[Japan]) was established in Hokkaido.

sen.j: 3県と事業管理局は、1886年1月26日の北海道庁 (1886-1947)設置に伴って廃止（「廃県置庁（はいけんちちょう）」）された。
sen.e: These three prefectures and the Bureau were abolished due to establishment of the Hokkaido government on January 26, 1886 ("Haiken Chicho," or abolishment of prefectures and establishment of local government).

These three prefectures and the Bureau were abolished due to establishment of the Hokkaido government on January 26, 1886 ('Haiken Chicho,' or abolishment of prefectures and establishment of local government).
sen.cmt: クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: These three prefectures and the Bureau were abolished due to establishment of the Hokkaido government on January 26, 1886 ('Haiken Chicho,' or abolishment of prefectures and establishment of local government).

sen.j: 1871年10月3日（明治4年8月19日_(旧暦)）、当時の北海道開拓使は北海道の開拓の目処として翌72年から10年間1,000万円をもって総額とするという大規模予算計画、いわゆる開拓使十年計画を決定していた。
sen.e: On October 3, 1871, Hokkaido Development Commissioner decided on a large-scale budget plan called the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner, which estimated the total budget for development of Hokkaido during the ten years after 1872 to be ten million yen.

On October 3, 1871, Hokkaido Development Commissioner decided on a large-scale budget plan called the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner, which estimated the total budget for development of Hokkaido during the ten years after 1872 to be ten million yen.

On October 3, 1871, Hokkaido Development Commissioner decided on a large-scale budget plan called the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner, which estimated the total budget for development of Hokkaido during the ten years after 1872 to be ten million yen.

sen.j: そして開拓使十年計画の満期を迎えた1882年、当初の計画通り北海道開拓使を廃止し、その当時置かれていた北海道開拓使の札幌市の本庁および函館市・根室市の2支庁のそれぞれの管轄区域に応じて道外と同様に県という行政区域を新たに3つ設定することになった。
sen.e: When the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner was completed in 1882, Hokkaido Development Commissioner was abolished as originally planned, and it was decided that administrative districts called "prefecture" were introduced just as outside Hokkaido and that three prefectures were newly established in accordance with jurisdictions of the government in Sapporo City and two offices in Hakodate and Nemuro Cities which had been administered by Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

When the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner was completed in 1882, Hokkaido Development Commissioner was abolished as originally planned, and it was decided that administrative districts called "prefecture" were introduced just as outside Hokkaido and that three prefectures were newly established in accordance with jurisdictions of the government in Sapporo City and two offices in Hakodate and Nemuro Cities which had been administered by Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

When the Ten-year Plan of Development Commissioner was completed in 1882, Hokkaido Development Commissioner was abolished as originally planned, and it was decided that administrative districts called "prefecture" were introduced just as outside Hokkaido and that three prefectures were newly established in accordance with jurisdictions of the government in Sapporo City and two offices in Hakodate and Nemuro Cities which had been administered by Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

sen.j: 開拓事業については、これらの3県と農商務省 (日本)管轄の北海道事業管理局とで地方レベル・国レベルを各々分担する形で引き継がれることになった。
sen.e: As for the development project, the three prefectures took over the works in the local level and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau, which was under No-Shomusho, took over the works in the national level.

As for the development project, the three prefectures took over the works in the local level and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau which was under Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce took over the works in the national level.
sen.cmt: 「農商務省」の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: As for the development project, the three prefectures took over the works in the local level and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau which was under Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce took over the works in the national level.

sen.j: 北海道開拓使の廃止直前に「開拓使官有物払下げ事件」が起きて混乱が生じたものの、1882年2月8日、予定通り北海道開拓使に代わって札幌県・函館県・根室県の3県が成立し、廃使置県が完成した。
sen.e: Though the "Scandal concerning Disposal of Hokkaido Development Commissioner's Possession," which took place just before abolition of Hokkaido Development Commissioner, resulted in a confusion, three prefectures, Sapporo, Hakodate and Nemuro, were established instead of Hokkaido Development Commissioner and Haishi Chiken was completed on February 8, 1882.

Though the 'Scandal concerning Disposal of Hokkaido Development Commissioner's Possession' which took place just before abolition of Hokkaido Development Commissioner resulted in a confusion, three prefectures, Sapporo, Hakodate and Nemuro, were established instead of Hokkaido Development Commissioner and Haishi Chiken was completed on February 8, 1882.
sen.cmt: コンマを除き、クオーテーションマークを修正しました。
sen.e: Though the 'Scandal concerning Disposal of Hokkaido Development Commissioner's Possession' which took place just before abolition of Hokkaido Development Commissioner resulted in a confusion, three prefectures, Sapporo, Hakodate and Nemuro, were established instead of Hokkaido Development Commissioner and Haishi Chiken was completed on February 8, 1882.

sen.j: この廃使置県によって北海道全体としては初めて正式な行政組織・行政区域を持つことになった。
sen.e: With this Haishi Chiken, Hokkaido had a formal administration agency and administrative districts for the first time.
With this Haishi Chiken, Hokkaido had a formal administration agency and administrative districts for the first time.
With this Haishi Chiken, Hokkaido had a formal administration agency and administrative districts for the first time.

sen.j: なお、道外の県とは異なり、これ以降も続く開拓使的な任務の都合や低過ぎる人口密度などのため、これらの3県に県議会や郡役所が正式に設置されることはなかった。
sen.e: Unlike prefectures outside Hokkaido, no prefectural assembly or county office was formally established in those three prefectures because of continuous tasks as a development commissioner and because of too low population density.

Unlike prefectures outside Hokkaido, no prefectural assembly or county office was formally established in those three prefectures because of continuous tasks as a development commissioner and because of too low population density.

Unlike prefectures outside Hokkaido, no prefectural assembly or county office was formally established in those three prefectures because of continuous tasks as a development commissioner and because of too low population density.

sen.j: 開拓を巡って3県と北海道事業管理局の方針の足並みを揃える事が出来ず、加えて松方財政の影響による不況によって財政収入が伸び悩み、却って開拓の障害となった。
sen.e: Haishi Chiken resulted in an obstacle to development after all, because the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau could not align their policy with the others' in connection with development, and because the income stopped growing due to the economic slowdown under the financial administration of MATSUKATA.

Haishi Chiken resulted in an obstacle to development after all, because the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau could not align their policy with the others' in connection with development, and because the income stopped growing due to the economic slowdown under the Matsukata finance (also known as the Matsukata deflation, a financial measure to induce deflation to eliminate inflation generated by raising funds for war cost of the Seinan War).
sen.cmt: 「松方財政」に補足を加えました。MATSUKATA→小文字に修正しました。
sen.e: Haishi Chiken resulted in an obstacle to development after all, because the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau could not align their policy with the others' in connection with development, and because the income stopped growing due to the economic slowdown under the Matsukata finance (also known as the Matsukata deflation, a financial measure to induce deflation to eliminate inflation generated by raising funds for war cost of the Seinan War).

sen.j: また、当時（1886年）の北海道全域の人口は26万5千人に過ぎず、うち半数以上にあたる15万1千人が松前藩時代以来の集住地域である函館県に集中し、逆に極寒の未開拓地が大半を占める根室県はわずか1万7千人という不均衡の問題が生じていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, while the population of the whole area of Hokkaido was only two hundred sixty-five thousand in 1886 and more than half of the population (one hundred fifty-one thousand) concentrated in Hakodate Prefecture, where people had lived in groups since the age of Matsumae Domain, Nemeuro Prefecture, which consisted mostly of extremely cold undeveloped land, had a population of only seventeen thousand, and this posed a problem of an imbalance.

Furthermore, while the population of the whole area of Hokkaido was only two hundred sixty-five thousand in 1886 and more than half of the population (one hundred fifty-one thousand) concentrated in Hakodate Prefecture where people had lived in groups since the age of the Matsumae Domain, and Nemeuro Prefecture which consisted mostly of extremely cold undeveloped land had a population of only seventeen thousand, and this posed a problem of an imbalance.
sen.cmt: コンマを除き、and を加えました。
sen.e: Furthermore, while the population of the whole area of Hokkaido was only two hundred sixty-five thousand in 1886 and more than half of the population (one hundred fifty-one thousand) concentrated in Hakodate Prefecture where people had lived in groups since the age of the Matsumae Domain, and Nemeuro Prefecture which consisted mostly of extremely cold undeveloped land had a population of only seventeen thousand, and this posed a problem of an imbalance.

sen.j: そこで参議伊藤博文は1885年に太政官大書記官金子堅太郎を北海道に派遣した。
sen.e: Thus Sangi (Councillor) Hirobumi ITO sent Kentaro KANEKO, a great secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State), to Hokkaido in 1885.
Thus Sangi (Councillor) Hirobumi ITO sent Kentaro KANEKO, a great secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State), to Hokkaido in 1885.
Thus Sangi (Councillor) Hirobumi ITO sent Kentaro KANEKO, a great secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State), to Hokkaido in 1885.

sen.j: 70日余りの視察を終えて帰京した金子は現行の3県体制が機能していないことを報告した。
sen.e: KANEKO made a seventy-day inspection tour of Hokkaido and, returning to the capital, reported that the present system of three prefectures did not function.
Kaneko made a seventy-day inspection tour of Hokkaido and returning to the capital, reported that the present system of three prefectures did not function.
sen.cmt: KANEKO→Kanekoに, コンマを除きました。
sen.e: Kaneko made a seventy-day inspection tour of Hokkaido and returning to the capital, reported that the present system of three prefectures did not function.

sen.j: この報告を受ける形で1886年1月26日、3県及び北海道事業管理局を統廃合して内務省 (日本)管轄の北海道庁に移行する廃県置庁が行われることになり、3県はその役目を終えた。
sen.e: Based on this report, the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau were reorganized into the Hokkaido government, which was under the (prewar) Ministry of Home Affairs, on January 26, 1886 and the three prefectures went out of existence.

Based on this report, the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau were reorganized into the Hokkaido government which was under the Ministry of Home Affairs on January 26, 1886 and the three prefectures went out of existence.
sen.cmt: (prewar) とコンマを除きました。
sen.e: Based on this report, the three prefectures and Hokkaido Works Administration Bureau were reorganized into the Hokkaido government which was under the Ministry of Home Affairs on January 26, 1886 and the three prefectures went out of existence.

sen.j: なお、旧函館県及び根室県の組織はそのまま北海道庁函館支庁及び根室支庁として、1890年11月5日の支庁制移行まで継続される事になった。
sen.e: The organization of former Hakodate and Nemuro Prefectures was succeeded by Hakodate and Nemuro offices of the Hokkaido government, and continued until the transition to the subprefecture system on November 5, 1890.

The organization of former Hakodate and Nemuro Prefectures was succeeded by Hakodate and Nemuro offices of the Hokkaido government, and continued until the transition to the subprefecture system on November 5, 1890.

The organization of former Hakodate and Nemuro Prefectures was succeeded by Hakodate and Nemuro offices of the Hokkaido government, and continued until the transition to the subprefecture system on November 5, 1890.

sen.j: 開拓使函館支庁の管轄区域をもって成立する。
sen.e: It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Hakodate office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Hakodate office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Hakodate office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

sen.j: 県庁所在地は旧渡島国亀田郡の函館区。
sen.e: The capital existed in Hakodate-ku, former Kameda County, Oshima Province.
The seat of the prefectural capital was in Hakodate-ku, former Kameda County, Oshima Province.
sen.cmt: 県庁所在地→the seat of～としました。
sen.e: The seat of the prefectural capital was in Hakodate-ku, former Kameda County, Oshima Province.

sen.j: 県令は時任為基。
sen.e: The prefectural governor was Tamemoto TOKITO.
The prefectural governor was Tamemoto TOKITO.
The prefectural governor was Tamemoto TOKITO.

sen.j: 管轄地域は令制国に従えば、渡島国と後志国の久遠郡・奥尻郡・太櫓郡・瀬棚郡・寿都郡・島牧郡・歌棄郡・磯谷郡の8郡、胆振国山越郡に相当する。
sen.e: The jurisdictional area corresponds to Oshima Province, eight counties of Shiribeshi Province (Kudoo County, Okushiri County, Futoro County, Setana County, Suttsu County, Shimamaki County, Utasutsu County and Isoya County) and Iburi Province, Yamagoe County according to ryoseikoku (province).

The jurisdictional area corresponds to Oshima Province, eight counties of Shiribeshi Province (Kudo County, Okushiri County, Futoro County, Setana County, Suttsu County, Shimamaki County, Utasutsu County and Isoya County) and Yamagoe County of Iburi Province according to ryoseikoku (province).
sen.cmt: Kudoo→Kudo, Iburi Province, Yamagoe County→Yamagoe County of Iburi Province としました。
sen.e: The jurisdictional area corresponds to Oshima Province, eight counties of Shiribeshi Province (Kudo County, Okushiri County, Futoro County, Setana County, Suttsu County, Shimamaki County, Utasutsu County and Isoya County) and Yamagoe County of Iburi Province according to ryoseikoku (province).

sen.j: 開拓使本庁の管轄区域をもって成立する。
sen.e: It was established with the jurisdiction of the government of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the government of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the government of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

sen.j: 県庁所在地は旧石狩国札幌郡の札幌区。
sen.e: The capital existed in Sapporo-ku, former Sapporo County, Ishikari Province.
The seat of the prefectural capital was in Sapporo-ku, former Sapporo County, Ishikari Province.
sen.cmt: 県庁所在地→the seat of～としました。
sen.e: The seat of the prefectural capital was in Sapporo-ku, former Sapporo County, Ishikari Province.

sen.j: 県令は調所広丈。
sen.e: The prefectural governor was Hirotake CHOSHO.
The prefectural governor was Hirotake CHOSHO.
The prefectural governor was Hirotake CHOSHO.

sen.j: 管轄地域は令制国に従えば、石狩国・天塩国・十勝国・日高国の全域と北見国の宗谷郡・枝幸郡・利尻郡・礼文郡の4郡、後志国の小樽郡・高島郡・忍路郡・余市郡・古平郡・積丹郡・美国郡・古宇郡・岩内郡の9郡、胆振国の虻田郡・有珠郡・室蘭郡・幌別郡・白老郡・勇払郡・千歳郡の7郡（即ち山越郡以外の全域）に相当する。
sen.e: The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Ishikari, Teshio, Tokachi and Hidaka Provinces, four counties of Kitami Province (Soya County, Esashi County, Rishiri County and Rebun County), nine counties of Shiribeshi Province (Otaru County, Takashima County, Oshoro County, Yoichi County, Furubira County, Shakotan County, Bikuni County, Furuu County and Iwanai County), and seven counties of Iburi Province (Abuta County, Usu County, Muroran County, Horobetsu County, Shiraoi County, Yuufutsu County and Chitose County), according to ryoseikoku.

The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Ishikari, Teshio, Tokachi and Hidaka Provinces, four counties of Kitami Province (Soya County, Esashi County, Rishiri County and Rebun County), nine counties of Shiribeshi Province (Otaru County, Takashima County, Oshoro County, Yoichi County, Furubira County, Shakotan County, Bikuni County, Furuu County and Iwanai County), and seven counties of Iburi Province (Abuta County, Usu County, Muroran County, Horobetsu County, Shiraoi County, Yufutsu County and Chitose County), according to ryoseikoku.

The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Ishikari, Teshio, Tokachi and Hidaka Provinces, four counties of Kitami Province (Soya County, Esashi County, Rishiri County and Rebun County), nine counties of Shiribeshi Province (Otaru County, Takashima County, Oshoro County, Yoichi County, Furubira County, Shakotan County, Bikuni County, Furuu County and Iwanai County), and seven counties of Iburi Province (Abuta County, Usu County, Muroran County, Horobetsu County, Shiraoi County, Yufutsu County and Chitose County), according to ryoseikoku.

sen.j: 地理的には十勝国十勝郡の東端と宗谷岬（北）・神威岬（西）・襟裳岬（南）の3つの岬を四至としていた。
sen.e: Geographically the eastern end of Tokachi County of Tokachi Province, Cape Soya (north), Cape Kamui (west) and Cape Erimo (south) were regarded as Shishi (the northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries of a tract of land).

Geographically the eastern end of Tokachi County of Tokachi Province, Cape Soya (north), Cape Kamui (west) and Cape Erimo (south) were regarded as Shishi (the northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries of a tract of land).

Geographically the eastern end of Tokachi County of Tokachi Province, Cape Soya (north), Cape Kamui (west) and Cape Erimo (south) were regarded as Shishi (the northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries of a tract of land).

sen.j: 開拓使根室支庁の管轄区域をもって成立する。
sen.e: It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Nemuro office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Nemuro office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.
It was established with the jurisdiction of the former Nemuro office of Hokkaido Development Commissioner.

sen.j: 県庁所在地は旧根室国根室郡の根室梅ヶ枝町（根室県廃止後の1900年に根室町と改称）。
sen.e: The capital existed in Nemuro-umegae-cho (renamed Nemuro-cho in 1900, after abolishment of Nemuro Prefecture), former Nemuro County, Nemuro Province.
The seat of the prefectural capital was in Nemuroumegae-cho (renamed Nemuro-cho in 1900 after abolishment of Nemuro Prefecture), former Nemuro County, Nemuro Province.
sen.cmt: 県庁所在地→the seat of～としました。Nemuro-umegae→Nemuroumegaeとして、括弧内のコンマを除きました。
sen.e: The seat of the prefectural capital was in Nemuroumegae-cho (renamed Nemuro-cho in 1900 after abolishment of Nemuro Prefecture), former Nemuro County, Nemuro Province.

sen.j: 県令は湯地定基。
sen.e: The prefectural governor was Hirotake.CHOSHO
The prefectural governor was Sadamoto YUCHI.
sen.cmt: 名前が間違っているので修正しました。
sen.e: The prefectural governor was Sadamoto YUCHI.

sen.j: 管轄地域は令制国に従えば、根室国・釧路国・千島国の全域と北見国の紋別郡・常呂郡・網走郡・斜里郡の4郡に相当する。
sen.e: The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Nemuro, Kushiro and Chitose Provinces and four counties of Kitami Province (Monbetsu County, Tokoro County, Abashiri County and Shari County), according to reiseikoku.

The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Nemuro, Kushiro and Chitose Provinces and four counties of Kitami Province (Monbetsu County, Tokoro County, Abashiri County and Shari County), according to ryoseikoku.

The jurisdictional area corresponds to the whole area of Nemuro, Kushiro and Chitose Provinces and four counties of Kitami Province (Monbetsu County, Tokoro County, Abashiri County and Shari County), according to ryoseikoku.
